name: Refresh my memory please - Deathless Vigor HP gain.
author: Maximillian_Kane

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
When you level up a PM, you get Deathless Vigor, which adds +3 to your HP. I played a PM to level 38 a long time ago and I don't remember.

My question is: like Toughness, does it also appear at level up? Meaning, if I'm trying to roll max HP, do I need to include them or do they get applied afterwards?

Thanks!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi Max.

My understanding is that the +3 is applied as soon as you choose the class, in the same way as Toughness (though without applying retrospectively, of course!). I wonder if you could send the game into meltdown if you take a PM level and Toughness as a feat at the same level - even more so if you get a CON boost at the same time!

Cheers
